title: List of prime ministers of India - Wikipedia
snippet: Jawaharlal Nehru was India's first prime minister, serving as prime minister of the Dominion of India from 15 August 1947 until 26 January 1950, and thereafter of the Republic of India until his death in May 1964. (India conducted its first post-independence general elections in 1952).

title: Former Prime Ministers | Prime Minister of India
snippet: Shri H. D. Deve Gowda, a staunch crusader of socio-economic development and an ardent admirer of the rich cultural heritage of India, was born on May 18, 1933 in Haradanahalli village of Holenarasipura taluk, Hassan District in Karnataka. title: Prime Minister of India - Wikipedia
snippet: The prime minister controls the selection and dismissal of members of the Union Council of Ministers and allocation of posts to members within the government. The longest-serving prime minister was the first prime minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, whose tenure lasted 16 years and 286 days.

title: PM Sangrahlaya - a Tribute to India's Prime Ministers
snippet: The Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya in New Delhi is a tribute by our nation to the Prime Ministers who rebuilt India after Independence
